entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Expose kLocalAndCloud query source
entry.content:
Drive currently only exposes query via the local database OR an

exclusively cloud only query. This is not the most optimal as Drive for

desktop on other platforms tries first locally and if that hits the

local fence, only then tries a cloud query. To avoid moving all the

existing search queries to this functionality, expose the functionality

only to be used on an opt in basis.



Related Drive CL: cl/527511750



Fixed: b:279844387

entry.content:
We allowed to configure DM serve URL for test with crrev/c/4395471.

But the configured value is not actually picked up. This CL does this.



Also removed the reference to policy service from policy fetcher. And

the service policy no longer has the fetcher as a member. Instead, a

policy fetcher is created at the beginning of policy fetch, and

owned by the callback until policy fetch done.

entry.title: Make PA_NOTREACHED() [[noreturn]]
entry.content:
This effectively migrates PartitionAlloc from NOTREACHED() to

NOTREACHED_NORETURN() making PA_NOTREACHED() errors fatal.



RawCheck is also renamed RawCheckFailure and marked as [[noreturn]] both

inside partition_alloc/ and base/. RawError is drive-by cleaned up as

it's now dead code in both places.



Bug: 851128, 1434283

entry.title: [Files]: Adds fuzzer for CreateFnmatchQuery function.
entry.content:
CreateFnmatchQuery is one of two functions used when searching for

matching files that receives direct user input. The fnmatch pattern is

created from the query entered by the user. In order to check that it

behaves correctly regardless of the user entered input, we add a fuzzer

test. The test runs the CreateFnmatchQuery function with text created

directly from the data supplied by the fuzzer.



Bug: b:277834224

Change-Id: Ic96ce53d56535b6aaba37f23919a4fcbc7fcd9fd

entry.title: Reland "WebNN: Re-enable the WPT"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 2fe5041ab5935ae6bd8a6afeb105e96372cb0db0



This CL fixes the WebNN WPT failure for `reduce` ops by rebaselining

according to the new test cases imported by CL-4477164 [1].



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4477164



Original change's description:

> WebNN: Re-enable the WPT

>

> WebNN WPT tests were disabled because of the `gemm` op test failure that

> prevents TFLite and XNNPACK weekly rolling CL [1]. This rolling includes

> a XNNPACK commit that supports FP16 dynamic fully connected [2], however

> the current WebNN WPT "gemm two float32 2D tensors (b is non-constant)

> default options" test uses FP32 operands [3], which caused the failure.

>

> This CL updates the WPT baseline according to the test results of the

> new version of third_party/xnnpack and re-enables the WebNN WPT tests.

>

> [1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4420606

> [2]: https://github.com/google/XNNPACK/commit/65c930ab40a40573557550595716d9ffc8ee8de6

> [3]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/webnn/resources/test_data/gemm.json#L4

>

> Bug: 1432448,1273291

> Change-Id: I579fcd754e1b14e066bedcdf295f1401150d593a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4455711

> Reviewed-by: Michael Crouse

> Reviewed-by: Jiewei Qian

entry.title: geolocation: Report kPositionUnavailable with no estimate
entry.content:
When GeolocationImpl::SetOverride is called to override the position

estimate, we first report the current geoposition result before

reporting the overridden estimate. If SetOverride is called before any

provider has provided a position estimate, the current position will

be nullptr. Reporting a nullptr geoposition result is an error.



To fix this, check if the current geoposition result is nullptr and,

if so, initialize it to a geoposition error with error code

kPositionUnavailable before reporting.



Bug: 1440080

Change-Id: Id983f8a74cb64ae3c82a8940af79adb7ba8d104e

entry.title: Enable DWM fullscreen optimizations for video playback.
entry.content:
Compared with local video playback on Windows, for example the native

“Movies & TV” application, DWM optimizaitons, like to turn off the

desktop plan, can be turned on during fullscreen playback. With the

help from Microsoft DWM team, we can do the same optimizations on

Chromium as well.



Currently, it is behind the flag of

DirectCompositionLetterboxVideoOptimization, which is set to disabled by default.



The power measurement shows about 15% saving (about 480mw out of 3.2w package power) in the scenario of 1080p display for 4K ultrawide video decoding on TigerLake laptop.



Bug: 1027046

entry.title: Use WeakPtrFactory instead of Unretained in CrOSComponentInstaller
entry.content:
CrOSComponentInstallerChromeOS is not guaranteed to out-live

ImageLoaderClient which sends back the callbacks.

This CL removes such risk by using WeakPtrFactory which automatically

invalidates the weak ptr on CrOSComponentInstallerChromeOS destruction.



Ref: crrev.com/c/4439171/comment/e0541919_a8ef0769/

entry.title: Fix bug in ambient metrics naming.
entry.content:
The current code is recording metrics like this if the user picked

a video theme in the past and then switched back to slideshow:

Ash.AmbientMode.StartupTime.SlideShow.NewMexico



It should be:

Ash.AmbientMode.StartupTime.SlideShow



We do not bother to erase the "video" portion of the AmbientUiSettings

when we switch from video to another theme. This is not a problem.

The problem is that the video should be getting ignored.

entry.content:
This enables to specify SVC encoding by SVC scalability mode string

[1] in video_encode_accelerator_tests and

entry.title: WebView: Removing jitter from Fast Fetch mode
entry.content:
Current implementation of AwVariationsSeedFetcher utilizes an API

(PostTask#postDelayedTask) that relies on the native library being

loaded. Since the native library is never loaded, this makes it

impossible for that API to ever work. This change removes the usage of the API and adds a TODO to replace the API usage with a similar

functionality to produce jitter in the seed fetch requests. Since this feature will not be complete until the TODOs are addressed, the

NonEmbeddedFastVariationsSeedSafeModeAction is being de-registered until

the issues are properly addressed.

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Add nullptr checks for wl::RootWindowFromWlSurface
entry.content:
The crash might happen in wayland_touch.cc during a touch down event.

wl::RootWindowFromWlSurface returns null when either the wl_surface

itself is null, or if the WaylandSurface pointer stored in its user

data is null. In this case it was the latter. All other places where

wl::RootWindowFromWlSurface is called do check for null, except for the

call in wayland_pointer.cc. This adds the check for the remaining call

sites.

entry.title: Revert "graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f4be552b5bf508c7e4b3c08fafa6f3484276c417.



Reason for revert: Suspected of breaking build

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-archive-rel/91415/overview



Original change's description:

> graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default

>

> Using ENABLE_SKIA_GRAPHITE build flag is proving to be burdensome in

> practice due to the many places where Viz/OOP-R would have to interact

> with Graphite. Just limiting build flag checks to Dawn/Metal backend

> specific code is more tractable. Binary cost increase for just building

> Skia Graphite core should be modest.

>

> Enabling Graphite build by default caused gn check to fail because:

> 1) Backend specific public includes were not split from private sources.

> Fixed by https://skia-review.googlesource.com/c/skia/+/677136

> 2) Shared GPU sources need to depend on private Graphite sources which

> requires splitting up the skia_graphite source set into separate

> public and private source sets - sources in the skia_graphite_private

> can be included only in the skia component whereas public files in

> skia_graphite_public are exported as skia component public_deps.

>

> Binary Size: Looking at the SuperSize report, most of the increase is

> Graphite code (~104kB), and some large SkSL shader strings (~18kB).

> Graphite is Skia's new GPU backend that's intended to replace

> the current GPU backend (Ganesh) completely. This CL makes Graphite

> core (i.e. not specific to any OS/native API) build by default in

> Chromium. See above for why we want to do this instead of using

> conditional build flags. Graphite will be rolled out in phases

> targeting Mac and Windows first, followed by Android and ChromeOS.

> Eventually, it is intended that Ganesh will be removed completely from

> Chromium which will signficantly reduce binary size.

>

> Binary-Size: See commit description.

> Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit description.

entry.title: graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default
entry.content:
Using ENABLE_SKIA_GRAPHITE build flag is proving to be burdensome in

practice due to the many places where Viz/OOP-R would have to interact

with Graphite. Just limiting build flag checks to Dawn/Metal backend

specific code is more tractable. Binary cost increase for just building

Skia Graphite core should be modest.



Enabling Graphite build by default caused gn check to fail because:

1) Backend specific public includes were not split from private sources.

Fixed by https://skia-review.googlesource.com/c/skia/+/677136

2) Shared GPU sources need to depend on private Graphite sources which

requires splitting up the skia_graphite source set into separate

public and private source sets - sources in the skia_graphite_private

can be included only in the skia component whereas public files in

skia_graphite_public are exported as skia component public_deps.



Binary Size: Looking at the SuperSize report, most of the increase is

Graphite code (~104kB), and some large SkSL shader strings (~18kB).

Graphite is Skia's new GPU backend that's intended to replace

the current GPU backend (Ganesh) completely. This CL makes Graphite

core (i.e. not specific to any OS/native API) build by default in

Chromium. See above for why we want to do this instead of using

conditional build flags. Graphite will be rolled out in phases

targeting Mac and Windows first, followed by Android and ChromeOS.

Eventually, it is intended that Ganesh will be removed completely from

Chromium which will signficantly reduce binary size.



Binary-Size: See commit description.

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit description.

Bug: 1429361

entry.content:
When the scope requested is broad (i.e. beyond sharing the basic

profile), the browser opens a pop-up window rather than mediate the

permission prompt.



The client metadata is used only for the permission prompt, so

entry.title: saved_desks: Implement update coalescing for admin templates
entry.content:
This change makes so that updates to tracked admin template windows are

held for a duration (5 seconds by default) before being sent to the

storage model. Window updates that happen while the timer is running are

merged. When the timer eventually fires, the most recent state is sent

to the storage model.



This is done so that operations like dragging a window do not result in

a flood of updates to the storage model.



This change also slightly changes the creation of launch trackers. If

there is an existing tracker for a template that is going to be

launched, the old tracker is first destroyed.



BUG=b:279823433

entry.title: Implement SQLitePersistentSharedDictionaryStore
entry.content:
This CL introduces SQLitePersistentSharedDictionaryStore and

SharedDictionaryInfo, and moves SharedDictionaryStorageIsolationKey

class from services/network to net/extras to use it in

SQLitePersistentSharedDictionaryStore.



SharedDictionaryInfo class represents the metadata information of a

shared dictionary.



SQLitePersistentSharedDictionaryStore class will be used to persist the

SharedDictionaryInfo to the persistent storage using Sqlite.

Currently we implement only 4 methods (RegisterDictionary,

GetDictionaries, GetAllDictionaries and ClearAllDictionaries). We will

add more methods in later CLs.

entry.title: [Extensions] Track user script injections in ContentScriptTracker
entry.content:
Extend ContentScriptTracker to also track user script injections by

extensions. This allows us to use ContentScriptTracker to determine if

a user script was ever injected in a given process and use this

information when validating IPCs from the renderer (such as initiating

message channels).



We track content scripts and user scripts separately within

ContentScriptTracker (that is, we can distinguish between whether an

extension injected a user script or a content script); this is important

because these contexts have different privileges and capabilities.



Update callers and consumers to specify the type of script they are

interested in or reporting. Note that since user scripts aren't

currently exposed to extensions, the only way user scripts are currently

triggered is via programmatic calls to ScriptExecutor.



Extend ContentScriptTracker browsertests and add another exploit

browsertest exercising the user of the ContentScriptTracker in

message validation.



Bug: 1186557, 1429408

Change-Id: I12b7ffd9fec9c468efb0fc4292995b49c101f239

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4477545

Reviewed-by: Emilia Paz

Reviewed-by: Łukasz Anforowicz

entry.title: cros_next: Adjust the transform window bounds to make it aligned
entry.content:
Adjust the bounds of the transformed window to make it aligned with the

header view of overview item.



Previously, the code checks whether the widths are equal or not. But there is an use case that the widths are equal, but the origin points

differ.



This CL fixed it by always adjusting the bounds if the window's

dimension's type is not pillar type.



For pillar type windows, the backdrop view is wider than the transformed

window, and backdrop view is part of the window mini view and is

guaranteed to be aligned with the header view.



Bug: b/279467360

entry.title: HTTPS-First Mode: Unenforce HFM for low HTTPS site engagement scores
entry.content:
This CL adds the ability to remove hostnames from the HTTPS enforcement

list. A heuristic that uses Site Engagement scores can add sites to

this list so that HTTPS-First Mode is enabled on sites with high HTTPS

engagement scores and low HTTP engagement scores.



To prevent sites from being added to and removed from the list

repeatedly, two new site engagement thresholds are introduced. For a

site to be removed from the list, its scores must be slightly

different from the scores used to add the site to the list.



This CL also changes how the engagement list is stored. The entries are

currently stored as an empty dictionary in a website settings. This CL

adds an "enabled" key to this dictionary. The value of the key is set to

true when a site is added to the list and false when its removed. The

actual website entry isn't removed so that we can count the accumulated

number of hosts in a followup CL.



Bug: 1435222

Change-Id: I4c5e4f38c0c37f73e40fdec62dae1345c2ec1fb2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4470192

entry.title: Add EventType to ScopedDragDropObserver.
entry.content:
There are currently a few users of ScopedDragDropObserver and the

implicit assumption is that if `event` is present a drag is in

progress and if `event` is absent the drag has been completed or

cancelled.



This CL adds EventType to make this more explicit as well as adds

missing test coverage.

entry.title: Exit selector checking early for scrollbar part rules
entry.content:
Style rules of the form `.ancestor ::-webkit-scrollbar-*` would go

through a full match for every element that's a descendant of .ancestor,

since the pseudo selector part reaches the default case in

SelectorChecker::CheckPseudoElement(). But we would subsequently end up

throwing these rules away in ElementRuleCollector::DidMatchRule():



if (dynamic_pseudo > kLastTrackedPublicPseudoId) {

return;

}



With this CL, we check ::-webkit-scrollbar-* selector parts against the

match context and early exit if the rule does not apply.



Benchmark ScrollbarPseudoSelector.html results on local run.

Cloud VM, Intel(R) Xeon(R) Platinum 8370C CPU @ 2.80GHz.

Average of 5 runs each:

Base 14.18 ms

Test 6.74 ms (-52.5%)

entry.title: [dPWA] Adding union logic for ShortcutLocations
entry.content:
When performing an install, sometimes the app was already installed

and the OS shortcuts were never created. Currently the update logic

tries to look up the previous shortcuts to update, and this

can result in no shortcuts being created when they were supposed

to be. (This mostly seems to be an issue in tests).



To fix this, the "update" logic now also reads the shortcut

creation options provided to the Synchronize call, and does

a union of those options and the shortcut locations it finds

locally. This allows the Update logic to create shortcuts in places

that didn't have shortcuts previously.

entry.content:
The change reassigns Clipboard suggestions to the PZPS group on the

NTP/Start contexts.



There are technically two ways this could be addressed with the

Grouping framework:

- Assigning Clipboard Matches to the PZPS Group or Clipboard-dedicated

group (which is what this change does), or

- Assigning Clipboard Group to the PZPS Section.



The latter is impractical, because Groups-to-Sections assignments are

statically (though lazily) constructed and not mapped to page

contexts.

entry.title: Hiding a mojo call underneath `qrcode_generator/public/cpp` API.
entry.content:
After this CL `mojo::Remote` is an

internal implementation detail that higher layers don't need to be aware

of. In the future this will allow to make a base::Feature-based runtime

decision to use in-process Rust (instead of calling C++ over mojo).



Note that some parts of the public API still depend on mojo:



* `mojom::GenerateQRCodeRequest` and `mojom::GenerateQRCodeResponse` (as

well as types contained inside - e.g. `mojom::LocatorStyle`). These

have to be kept as mojo types to support the (now internal)

`mojom::QRCodeGeneratorService` interface - having equivalent pure-C++

types would be possible but would result in code duplication. We can

switch to pure-C++ API once the Rusty QR project successfully ships.



* `set_disconnect_handler`. This will be removed shortly in a follow-up

CL: https://crrev.com/c/4481778



* Guarantees around the timing when `GenerateQRCodeResponse` is passed

to a callback. These guarantees are kept for now, but in the future

`GenerateQRCode` should be a regular, synchronous C++ method.



Having mojo-agnostic public API means that unit tests had to be

refactored. Dependency injection is done via `base::RepeatingCallback`

rather than by exposing virtual methods via the C++ class, because the

class will be going away in the long-term.



Bug: 1431991

Change-Id: Icf96e2a7ec117b4a08bc31e5fcf992178c72e554

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4482037

Reviewed-by: Gavin Williams

Commit-Queue: Łukasz Anforowicz

Reviewed-by: Adam Langley

entry.title: Multiplanar: Set format type and cleared for D3DBacking
entry.content:
This change plumbs the needs_cleared bool to D3DImageBacking and

entry.title: Replace test-only AttributionManager-reset with WebTestControlHost reset
entry.content:
Like cookies, persistent Attribution Reporting data needs to be

cleared between web tests in order to avoid interference. We currently

achieve this with a test-only JS method, but it is simpler to do so

in the same way that cookies are cleared in the WebTestControlHost.



This also has the benefit of reducing the API surface of the

StoragePartition, AttributionManager, and AttributionStorageSql

interfaces while simultaneously using only the public APIs of each of

them.



For tests that do not use Attribution Reporting (which is the vast

majority of them), the runtime cost of this is effectively the cost of

posting a no-op task to the Attribution Reporting storage sequence.



Bug: 1439886

Change-Id: I8cb5d3bcc99b6a77a2e9731297624230c4b1645e

of the response. Based on this, this CL removes the

entry.title: Add metrics to FLEDGE Latency UKM on delays to beginning ScoreAds.
entry.content:
There are a couple of scenarios in which GenerateBid can complete before

a SellerWorklet can begin processing that bid, most commonly, the

unavailability of a SellerWorklet due to concurrency limits. In this

case, the bids are enqueued on InterestGroupAuction::unscored_bids_, and

later scored when the SellerWorklet is ready to do so. These metrics

record any such delays and their associated cause.

entry.title: [Extensions] Handle CSP updates to previous user script worlds
entry.content:
If an extension updates a user script world in a process that already

had one created, we need to proactively set the new CSP on that world.

Otherwise, newly-created documents may greedily initialize the CSP of

a world to be the old CSP, even though no user scripts have executed

yet.



Update the CSP of user script worlds for any newly-created worlds on

CSP update.



Add browsertests for:

- The common case of a new document having the updated user script world

(the main motivation of this CL).

- An uncommon case of a new document being created with the cached user

script world. This happens when the document greedily initializes the

world CSP. This is generally okay (since the world, in essence, exists

at that point).

- The case of re-injecting into an existing user script world (the

world's CSP should definitely not be updated).



Bug: 1429408

Change-Id: I176ecfd20d54d02987543f74e6ea527da682ac43

entry.title: Dictation: Add ContextChecker class
entry.content:
This change implements a generalized solution for context-checking and

uses it for the UnselectTextMacro. Each macro can now specify the

contexts where it fails to run, allowing all macros to share the same

base context-checking implementation.



This change also removes the willImmediatelyDisambiguate field, since

it currently is not used and disambiguation is not in this year's OKRs.



Please see the design document [1] for more details.



[1] go/dictation-context-checking-impl
